item.title: Rerun last command with bang
item.description: Put this little vim script in your .vimrc to rerun the previous command with the bang (!) by just typing :Please. function! BangLastCommand()" The last command that was run is stored in the register `:` (:registers) let lastcommand = split(@:, ' ') let command = lastcommand[0] . '! ' . join(lastcommand[1:], ' ') execute command endfunctioncommand! Please call BangLastCommand() So, now, if you do: :e ~/.vimrc And you get an error because the current file has to be save, something like:
